***
## Stage 1 Kwisitis VC Waste Water Upgrades - Pacific Rim National Park Reserve

* **Reference Number**: cb-5523-20880214
* **Amendment Number**: 2
* **Solicitation Number**: 5P468-23-0041/A
* **Publication Date**: 2023-05-12
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2023-05-30T16:00:00
***

## Summary
The Parks Canada Agency is seeking bid proposals for the Stage 1 Kwisitis VC Waste Water Upgrades - Pacific Rim National Park Reserve project. The project involves the provision of site improvements at the Kwisitis Visitor Centre, including sewage upgrades and earthwork remediation.

## Project Description
The scope of work includes the supply and installation of a new fibreglass reinforced plastic sewage storage tank, new sewage piping to connect to the existing pump station, minor pump station improvements, drainage improvements, and site restoration. The project is estimated to be valued between $100,001 and $250,000.

## Bidder Instructions
This is a two-stage selection process. Bidders are requested to submit a bid in two stages. The first stage will evaluate the qualifications of all interested suppliers, and the second stage will invite qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings.

## How to Submit a Bid
Bids can be submitted by fax or email to the address listed below. Bidders must ensure that their bids meet the requirements outlined in the solicitation document. Please note that only the email address soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca will be accepted for bid submissions. The maximum email file size that Parks Canada can receive is 15 megabytes.

## Important Dates
The tender closing date is 2023-05-30T16:00:00. Bidders must ensure that their bids are received by this date to be considered. Late submissions will not be accepted.

## Contact Information
For any technical or contractual inquiries, please contact Carmen Song at (604) 358-9479 or carmen.song@pc.gc.ca.

## Additional Information
National Parks Regulations require that all work be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act. Bidders must ensure that they are aware of and comply with these regulations.
